Main package

Main.Server module

class Main.Server.ChatServerFactory(url)[source]

Bases: WebSocketServerFactory

Factory for WebSocket Servers

broadcast(message, sender)[source]

This method broadcasts the message to all clients in the chat

Parameters:

  • message – The message to broadcast

  • sender – Sender client of the message

getUsernameAndLang()[source]

This methods compiles a list of all usernames and languages participating in the chat

Return client_list:

List of clients and their set language

register(client)[source]

This method adds a client to the list of chat participants

Parameters:

client – client to be registered

sendCurrentUsers()[source]

This method sends a list of all clients currently registered to the server

unregister(client)[source]

This method removes the client from the list of chat participants

Parameters:

client – client to be removed

class Main.Server.ChatServerProtocol[source]

Bases: WebSocketServerProtocol

WebSocket Server

chatHistory = []
onClose(wasClean, code, reason)[source]

This method is called when the websocket connection closes

Parameters:

  • wasClean – boolean whether the connection was closed cleanly

  • code – status code of the connection close

  • reason – cause for connection close

onConnect(request)[source]

This method connects a client to the server

Parameters:

request – incoming request from the client

onMessage(payload, isBinary)[source]

This method receives a message from a client, calls translation, sentiment analysis, chatbot and distributes it among the chat participants

Parameters:

  • payload – incoming message from the client

  • isBinary – Boolean indicating whether a message is binary or not

Raises:

HTTPStatus – 400 Bad Request if the incoming message is malformed

onOpen()[source]

This method registers a new client when the connection is openned

Main.ServerFuncs package

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper module

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.checkSentiment(chatHistory: list) → float[source]

This method calculates the average sentiment of the last 5 messages in the chatHistory

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return sentiment_value:

average sentiment of the last 5 messages

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.create_chatbot(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient[source]

This method creates a chatbot and forwards a list of the last 5 messages to it

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return message:

Answer from the chatbot

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.is_message_addressing_bot(message_str: str) → bool[source]

This method analyses if a message is addressing the chatbot. For this, it compares the similarity of the incoming string with the keyword “botify”

Parameters:

message_str – Incoming message as a string

Return Bool:

True if the incoming message is addressing the chatbot, False otherwise

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.listenToMessages(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient | None[source]

This method listens to incoming messages and determines whether the chatbot should be called

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return message object or None:

either return a message from the chatbot or None if the chatbot is not addressed

Main.ServerFuncs.Sentiment module

Main.ServerFuncs.Sentiment.sentiment_analysis(message: MessageFromClient) → MessageToClient[source]

This method analyses the sentiment of a given message

Parameters:

message – incoming message without a sentiment

Return message:

analysed message with a sentiment

Main.ServerFuncs.Translator module

Main.ServerFuncs.Translator.translate_text(message: MessageFromClient | MessageToClient) → MessageFromClient | MessageToClient[source]

This method translates an incoming message into the language specified in the message field message.language

Parameters:

message – incoming message in orignial language

Return message:

translated message
